numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph shows opinions about whether the world is getting better with each generation.
2. Many young people are 15-24-year-olds.
3. More young people than older people believe that the world is getting better with each generation.
4. Two countries have large differences between the opinions of younger people and older people.
5. The United States is one of these countries.
6. Japan is one of these countries.
7. In the United States, almost 65% of the younger group believes that the world is getting better with each generation.
8. In the United States, about 35% of the 40+ group believes that the world is getting better with each generation.
9. In Japan, about 60% of the 15-24-year-old group believes that the world is getting better with each generation.
10. In Japan, about 25% of the older group believes that the world is getting better with each generation.
11. In the United States, the difference between the younger group and the older group is large.
12. In Japan, the difference between the younger group and the older group is large.
13. I wonder why the United States and Japan have the largest differences.
14. Indonesia has high percentages for both groups.
15. In Indonesia, more than 75% of the younger group believes that the world is getting better with each generation.
16. In Indonesia, more than 75% of the older group believes that the world is getting better with each generation.
17. I wonder why the percentages in Indonesia are so high for both groups.
18. This poll includes the United States.
19. I live in the United States.
20. My age belongs to the age groups in the graph.
21. It is interesting to see how my generation views progress in bettering the world.
22. A title for the graph is "Each generation's thoughts on the bettering of the world".
